posts.body:
>>295a4874-9139-4cbc-8215-b544e710aee9
Exactly, You can distribute specific boards by pinning them on the home page of 08chan. It's a more focused option. But honestly if you're really scared of hosting illegal content then just use TOR+VPN and don't seed anything without personally browsing through it.
Criminal paraded through town in 2019. This timeline isn't so bad after all.

>>cfa5521f-e963-46f7-a0fd-330e00e93ffb
My thoughts exactly as well.
08chan is turning out to be a phoenix from ashes rather than a hidden bunker.
Changes to come like proper sage options will make it even better.

>>928763e8-7d5f-4a84-b757-1fdf5133fad9
>Honestly you should be more concerned with the guys who have seedboxes setup to download everything at once
The more redundancy out there the harder it is to track down the source.
>the groups of anons you'll end up being permanently attached to from use of the Mute function
So they've got an ID attached to the things I post. So what? Remember that data is spread far and wide. I can change the ID as much as I want too. I can even delete my data folder  under the Zeronet install files, taking away the original seeds for the things I've posted.
Of course this brings up the issue we'll have with old or unpopular content eventually being lost. But that's no different than rolling catalogs that cleared out old threads. We can still archive entire pages ourselves if we really want.

Some anons have mentioned bulletproffing strategies like a virtual machine that is in deepfreeze. So every time you start the machine you get a clean slate with a Zeronet install exe on the desktop, then you can easily delete all evidence after you're done browsing. Of course you can't seed with this. But if clean browsing is what you're after, you can get it. There will hopefully be plenty of us that aren't doing illegal shit and can seed the site so it's usable. The entire 8chan userbase should be big enough to collectively host the site with good speeds.

>>5dab33a1-9a36-44a9-af19-37760cbb8f1d
Kek, any preference on the font?

posts.subject: Reply
posts.body:
>>91b0aebd-639a-460c-ac12-a9baf6e1fa1f
Both working fine.

>>5801a581-398d-443d-9b58-a95aba81351a
Doesn't the pinning system on the homepage help distribute a specific board?
You're right about the size issues we'll have. The oldest thread held will be tied to the biggest seeders I think.

>>89ce5dda-2fa8-46c6-a7b8-6af2f14d3de3
Best watch yerself around here pardner. I wouldn't wanna hafta [M] ya.

We're still ironing out the kinks. There's a new host of problems with decentralized websites, but also a whole bunch of new power that comes along with it. Good to have you along for the fight.

>>31ae9d8c-8d16-48f1-843a-a7d399f113f1
This is going to be the push that makes decentralized websites a force to be reckoned with.
They're going to regret ever trying to deplatform 8chan...
Now the autists are loose and running free.
Gee what interesting questions. Just search the Kalergi Plan on your favorite search engine and you'll find all the answers you seek.

>>300e84a3-7934-46e4-858b-641869bf0b02
Tor and VPN, look into it.
We're still working on a best practice setup for browsing the decentralized wild west web.

>>08f4a2b2-fbb4-491b-b203-4fb80dd75f1e
I noticed that a working Tor browser was missing in the Zeronet install as well. Just install it from the torproject site.
https://www.torproject.org/

>>9f022588-c236-450b-bf60-98da7827c58d
Tor posts work fine in general, trouble must be on your end. There's an issue with images posted in Tor sessions, but that's posted in the sticky.

>>2bcbad76-298c-4708-b0c4-6fd13b98fbba
That's fine. We don't need the street creed of Ron.
This is the wild west here, free and open. The sheriff goes by no name and it's probably for the best.

>>f29981f7-ba92-4d6f-866b-51f18d89464d
Banning individual user IDs and banning all Qanon faggotry are not the same.
Those ID's that he (and everyone else) can mute, are freely regenerated on your own end too.
